    • Method Detail

      • route

        default java.util.Optional<RouterResult<E>> route​(HttpMethod method,
                                                  java.lang.String pathString)

      • route

        java.util.Optional<RouterResult<E>> route​(HttpMethod method,
                                          Path path)
        Finds the Route and endpoint (Router) which has been assigned responsibility for requests made to the given Path using the given HttpMethod. Routes must be registered with the router in advance using addRoute(HttpMethod, String, Object) or similar. If no route exists for the given method and path then an empty optional is returned instead.

      • addRoute

        default void addRoute​(HttpMethod method,
                      java.lang.String routeString,
                      E endpoint)
               throws RouteConflictException
        Assigns the given endpoint responsibility for requests made with the given HttpMethod to paths matching the given routeString.
        Parameters:
        method - the http method to bind to this endpoint . It's perfectly valid to call this function multiple times with the same route but different HttpMethods. This is useful for handling multiple request types with a single endpoint.
        routeString - a path-like string describing which paths this handler is responsible for. Examples include: "/books/moby-dick", "/users/*\/pets/*", etc. The star (*) symbol is a wildcard which matches any and all path elements for that position.
        endpoint - the endpoint which is responsible for handling requests made to paths following the form of this route. This endpoint will be returned by route(HttpMethod, String).
        Throws:
        RouteConflictException - if the given routeString overlaps another pre-existing route with the same HttpMethod. The route will not be overwritten.

      • addRoute

        void addRoute​(HttpMethod method,
              Route route,
              E endpoint)
       throws RouteConflictException
        Throws:
        RouteConflictException

      • getAllEndpoints

        java.util.Set<PositionedEndpoint<E>> getAllEndpoints​(Route prefix)
        Returns a set of PositionedEndpoints which are accessible via the given Route. The returned collection includes the endpoints defined on the given Route as well as all endpoints which exists on routes that descend from the given Route.

      • addRoute

        default void addRoute​(PositionedEndpoint<E> positionedEndpoint)
        Throws:
        RouteConflictException - if the given endpoint conflicts with a pre-existing endpoint within the router.
